New Records: Ryan Helsley achieved his MLB-leading 42nd save in 45 tries.
The Cardinals secured their first victory at the new Yankee Stadium (2009-present) and their first over the Yankees in the Bronx since Game 5 of the 1964 World Series.
Key Match Events: Ryan Helsley closed out the game with a strikeout using his slider, preserving the Cardinals' 6-5 victory.
Brendan Donovan hit a three-run homer to key a four-run third inning.
Giancarlo Stanton came within inches of tying the score with a drive off the center-field wall that cleared the bases.
Juan Soto hit a double off Helsley's 101.5 mph fastball in the ninth inning.
Helsley intentionally walked Aaron Judge before striking out Austin Wells to end the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Cardinals manager Oliver Marmol praised Helsley's ability to stay present and lock in during high-pressure moments.
Kyle Gibson saved an authenticated ball from the game to present to his father, Harold.
Ryan Helsley expressed his goal of achieving the club record for saves, acknowledging the significance of being among Cardinals greats.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The winning pitchers for the Cardinals in 1964 and 2024 were both named Gibson -- Bob in 1964 and Kyle in 2024.
The play-by-play voices for the Cardinals' victories in 1964 and 2024 were both named Caray -- Harry in 1964 and Chip in 2024.
